description: Borrowed from Middle French vehement (modern French véhément; compare Italian veemente, Portuguese veemente, Spanish vehemente); or from Latin vehemēns (“vehement; very eager; ardent, furious, impetuous; emphatic”), probably from vē- (“prefix meaning ‘lacking, too little’”) + mēns (“mind; intellect; judgment, reasoning”).

adjectives.description: vehement (comparative more vehement, superlative most vehement)

entries.meaning: Showing strong feelings; passionate; forceful or intense.
